data.meta_description: Katy Perry announced her new album, '143' will drop on September 20 â marking the 39-year-old singer's sixth studio album, and her first since 2020's Smile.
data.text:
Katy Perry announced her new album, ‘143’ will drop on September 20 – marking the 39-year-old singer’s sixth studio album, and her first since 2020âs Smile. According to a press release shared with PEOPLE, Perryâs forthcoming album marks a âsexy, fearless return to formâ for the 13-time Grammy-nominated artist.

Perry shared aÂ in a statement: âI set out to create a bold, exuberant, celebratory dance-pop album with the symbolic 143 numerical expression of love as a throughline message”. ‘143’ is a nod to the throwback pager translation for âI love youâ (the usage dates back to the early 1900s, per Dictionary.com.)

The lead single from 143, âWomanâs World,â is described as a âpowerful celebration of womanhood in all its forms.â Perry promoted her single on Instagram on July 4, paying tribute to her 2010 smash hit with a patriotic photo of herself wearing a bedazzled, star-shaped swimsuit emblazoned with stars and stripes: âBB UR A FIREWORK and speaking of work, WOMANâS WORLD IS GOING TO WORK IN ONE WEEK HAPPY 4TH â

The song, co-written alongside songwriter Chloe Angelides and producers Lukasz âDr. Lukeâ Gottwald, Vaughn Oliver, Rocco Did It Again!, and Aaron Joseph, arrived alongside the official video that just dropped, with Perry appearing as the ‘ultimate pin-up girl’ and taking on a construction site before sheâs hit by an anvil. The pop songstress then appears in a female-led apocalyptic world and causes fun mayhem with her fellow women, with influencer Trisha Paytas making a cameo appearance in the visual.

Take a look at the video for âWomanâs Worldâ – here.
